experience: You and Jan both know Lauretta (Laurie) Zerga, Jim Skidmore, and 51 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
You both worked at Charles Schwab from Nov 2016 to Dec 2016

Tenacious senior technologist with a lengthy track record in delivering systems implementation projects.  Certified scrum master, most recently successfully led the development and user adoption of a standardized software development management system for over 5000 users.  Expertise in TFS, JIRA, Salesforce, Sharepoint, Confluence, MS Office.

Led multiple successful development tools implementations (multiple versions of TFS, Visual Studio) and integrations (TFS to JIRA, “Bug Transfer”, JIRA/Remedy). Acquired new products as needed: identified solutions and vendors, managed user-based selection processes, negotiated with and managed vendors.   Supported implementation of Blueprint, SOA Test, Atlassian products (JIRA Agile, Confluence, Bitbucket, Bamboo), JIRA / Salesforce integration.  Developed and delivered end user training for TFS, TFS-Agile, TFS-SharePoint, JIRA, Confluence.

Deployed IBM Rational’s RUP system, modified to the firm’s specifications.  Developed and deployed training with the support of the firm’s corporate training department.  Acted as the firm’s RUP mentor for technical project teams.

Team leader / technical project manager for data quality projects in the mainframe / DB2 / COBOL LE Customer & Account environment.  Responsible for managing & sustaining "Match Merge"; Data Suppression Values (do not email, call, survey, etc).  Team leader for initial "Corporate Customer Database"; team leader for "CEA to EMMA" customer email address project.
Charles Schwab & Co., Inc (Venturi Technologies Contract)

Deployed infrastructure in support of applications.   Required comprehensive understanding of distributed systems, network technology and technical project management.  Projects included: New Retail Statement, eStatements, "AMS II" - the high-speed print facility in Coppell, along with supporting technology and technology changes in Phoenix and Brisbane.

Paranet, Inc. a small (1000 people) "People-Process-Technology" consulting company was purchased by Sprint in 1997.  The firm embedded consultant engineers to a wide variety of customers for both project and staff augmentation.The positions listed below between 12/1995 and 4/1997 occurred during my tenure.

Deployed to Chevron in San Ramon and SF between 12/1995 & 4/2000.  Provided technical support (2nd & 3rd level); managed infrastructure delivery projects.  Also acted as dedicated support to Chevron Shipping between 1998 & 2000, delivering infrastructure maintenance, project delivery, technical support.
Informantion Technology infrastructure design, delivery, management.
Designed & delivered desktop systems; provided desktop systems support; provided network support; provided training & education; managed telecom environment.
Business Process Improvement and Change Management

Lucinda and I worked closely for several years at Charles Schwab.  Not only was she a great collaborator, but her honest feedback and mindful coaching were personally beneficial.During the latter part of our professional association, Lucinda was responsible for driving the adoption of the Agile development methodology.  Her efforts moved the company from RUP to Agile in just a few years -- with limited funding and personnel.  Lucinda's creative energy, enthusiasm, and can-do attitude make her a joy to work with.
